author: Madurai Bureau
text:
As many as 150 teachers, including 50 women, affiliated to Joint Action Committee of Teachers’ Organisations courted arrest while attempting to block vehicular traffic on Palayamkottai Road opposite the Collectorate here on Sunday.

The teachers, who were staging the protest for the second consecutive day, demanded increase in salary on a par with what was paid to their counterparts working in Central government schools. They demanded the State government to scrap Teachers’ Eligibility Test and sought recruitment based on seniority. The contributory pension scheme must be replaced with the old pension scheme.

In Tirunelveli, about 250 teachers, including 72 women, courted arrest while attempting to stage a road roko near the railway junction.

Nagercoil

As many as 169 teachers, including 38 women, were arrested when they resorted to road blockade on the Nagercoil-Thiruvananthapuram National Highway near the Collectorate on Sunday.

They were detained in a marriage hall and released in the evening.

C. Vallivel, general secretary, Tamil Nadu Post Graduate Teachers’ Association (TNPGTA), and John Ubald, treasurer, Tamil Nadu Graduate Teachers’ Association (TNGTA), presided over the protest.
title: Teachers held for road blockade
